# Configuring S7F/FH hardware

# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules

# Response to CPU STOP

If "Keep last valid value" is set for this parameter, the last valid process value 0 or 1 is kept in events such as an abortion of PROFIsafe communication or STOP of the F CPU.

# Load voltage failure diagnostics

This parameter activates the diagnostic message for a load voltage failure to 2L+ and 3L+.
Q: What does the 'Keep last valid value' parameter do in the context of F-signal modules as described in the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?
A1: It retains the last valid process value (0 or 1) during events like PROFIsafe communication abortion or F CPU STOP.
A2: When set, this parameter ensures the last valid value is maintained if PROFIsafe communication is aborted or the F CPU stops.
A3: Maintains the previous valid process value in scenarios such as PROFIsafe communication failure or F CPU STOP.
A4: This setting keeps the last valid 0 or 1 value in case of PROFIsafe communication abortion or F CPU STOP.
A5: In events like PROFIsafe communication abortion or F CPU STOP, the 'Keep last valid value' parameter holds onto the last valid process value.

This parameter activates the diagnostic message for a load voltage failure to 2L+ and 3L+.
Q: How is the load voltage failure diagnostics parameter described in the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?
A1: It enables diagnostic messages for load voltage failures to 2L+ and 3L+.
A2: Activates diagnostic alerts when there's a failure in the load voltage to 2L+ and 3L+.
A3: This parameter turns on diagnostics for detecting load voltage failures at 2L+ and 3L+.
A4: When activated, it provides diagnostics for any load voltage failure affecting 2L+ and 3L+.
A5: The parameter is used to initiate diagnostic reporting for failures in the load voltage supplied to 2L+ and 3L+.
